Michigan Initial Health & Safety Training Module B
Section 1: Child Development

Developmental Milestones Cont.

In order to observe and monitor developmental milestones they are usually broken into categories. Some experts may separate them into more detailed groupings, but we will look at a common way to categorize them.

Hover or tab over the images below to see more information about developmental milestones.

Social/Emotional

Social/Emotional milestones identify how children interact with others and express their feelings.

Physical/Movement

Physical/Movement milestones focus on how children use their bodies. You may at times see this broken down into gross motor and fine motor skills.

Language/Communication

Language/Communication milestones refer to how children express their needs and share what they are thinking, as well as understand what is said to them.

Cognitive/Thinking

Cognitive/Thinking related milestones involve how children learn new things and solve problems. They also include how children explore their environment to figure things out.
